result.execSummary:
All charges against Tyrus V King in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyrus V King is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrus V King

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 29th, 2022.

Defendant Tyrus V King in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Tyrus V King.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. State informs the court they cannot contact the victim and moves to dismiss. Defense does not object.
Court ordered case DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE. Any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court.  
Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for bail hearing.  Cash bail has been posted. No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Misdemeanor Reserve.  Calendar call scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with BWD (07/07/1958) and JAB (11/05/1979)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tyrus V King in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Tyrus V King in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.
  This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
